report.title: Charles I, 1625
report.subtitle: Chapter VI. An Acte for the Graunt of two entire Subsidies graunted by the Temporaltie.[ Rot. Parl. nu. 6.]

section.head: Grant of Two entire Subsidies; viz. on Personal Estates (after Payment of Debts, &c.) 2s. 8d. in the Pound.
section.para: Most Excellent and most Gracious Soveraigne, wee your Majesties most humble, faithfull and loving Subje&bholigct;&bholngs;, your C&bhooov;mons assembled in your High Court of Parliament, taking into our due and serious Consideracion the manifold occasions which at your Majesties first entrance into the Governement of these your Realmes and Dominions doe presse your Majestie; and your most important Affaires, which both at home and abroad are now in Accion, and cannot but exhaust your Treasure beyond the ordinarie &bhopubrc;porcion of your setled Revenue; and with joy and comfort unexpressable, calling to minde the great hopes wee have received heretofore, and the &bhopcrl;sent Assurance wee now enjoy of your Majesties most Wise Religious and Gracious Government; As a pledge of our most bounden dutie and thankefullnes Wee humblie &bhopcrl;sent your Majestie with the free and cheerefull Gift of two entire Subsidies, which wee humblie beseech your Majestie graciouslie to accept, as the first fruit&bholngs; of the most dutifull Affeccions of your loyall and loving Subje&bholigct;&bholngs; devoted to your Service: And wee shall dailie and devoutlie pray unto the Almightie God, the King of King&bholngs; for a blessing from heaven upon your high and great Designes, that they may be successefull and prosperous to the glory of God, your Majesties eternall Honour and the restoring of the auncient renowne and glory of this Nacion.
Aliens and Popish Recusants Convi&bholigct;, 5s. 4d. in the Pound; Poll Tax on Aliens and Popish Recusants Convi&bholigct; not contributory as above 8d.

And therefore wee humbly beseech your Majestie, That it may be ena&bholigct;ed, and be it ena&bholigct;ed by the King&bholngs; most Excellent Majestie, the Lord&bholngs; Spirituall and Temporall, and C&bhooov;mons in this &bhopcrl;sent Parliament assembled, and by the authoritie of the same, that our said Soveraigne Lord the King&bholngs; Majestie, his Heires and Successors shall have receive and enjoy two entire Subsidies, to be rated taxed levied and paid at two severall payments, of every &bhopubr;son Spirituall and Temporall of what estate or degree he or they be of, according to the tenor of this A&bholigct; in manner and forme following, That is to saie; Aswell that every &bhopubr;son borne within this Realme of England Wales, or other the King&bholngs; Dominions, as all and every Fraternitie Guild Corporacion Misterie Brotherhood and Commonaltie corporate & not corporate within this Realme of England, Wales, or other the King&bholngs; Dominions being worth three pound&bholngs;, for every pound, as well in coine and the value of every pound that every such &bhopubr;sons, Fraternitie, Guild, Corporacion, Misterie Brotherhood and Commonaltie corporate or not corporate, hath of his or their owne, or any other to his or their use, As also Plate stocke of Merchandise, all manner of corne and graine, housholdstuffe, and of all other good&bholngs; moveable, aswell within this Realme as without, and of all such s&bhooov;mes of mony as to him or them is or shalbe owing whereof he or they trust in his or their conscience. surelie to be paid (except and out of the &bhopubrc;misses dedu&bholigct;ed such s&bhooov;mes of mony as he or they doe owe, and in his and their consciences intend trulie to pay, and except also the apparell of every such &bhopubr;sons, their wives and children belonging to their owne bodies, saving jewells gold silver stone and pearle) shall pay to and for either of the said Subsidies, two shillings eight pence of every pound. And also every Alien and Straunger borne out of the King&bholngs; obeysance, aswell Denizen and others inhabiting within this Realme; and also every Popish Recusant convi&bholigct;, or which before the tyme of the Assessement of the severall Subsidies by this &bhopcrl;sent A&bholigct; graunted shalbe a Popish Recusant convi&bholigct;, or which are or shalbe indi&bholigct;ed for Popish Recusancie, and their indi&bholigct;ments are or shalbe removed by Cerciorare, of every pound that he or they shall have in coine and the value of every pound in plate corne graine merchandize housholdstuffe or other good&bholngs; jewells chattell&bholngs; moveable and unmoveable as is aforesaid, as well within this Realme as without, and of all s&bhooov;mes of money to him or them owing, whereof he or they trust in his or their conscience to be paid (except and out of the &bhopcrl;misses dedu&bholigct;ed, every such s&bhooov;me or s&bhooov;mes of mony which he or they doe owe, and in his or their conscience or consciences intend trulie to pay) shall pay to and for each of the said Subsidies, five shillings foure pence of every pound. And also that every Alien and stranger borne, borne out of the King&bholngs; Dominions, being denizen or not denizen, not being contributorie to any the Rates aforesaid, and being of the age of seaven yeares or above, And every Popish Recusant convi&bholigct;, or which before the time of the Assessement of the severall Subsidies by this &bhopcrl;sent A&bholigct; graunted shalbe a Popish Recusant convi&bholigct; and being of the age of seaventeene yeares, or which being of the age of one and twentie yeares have not received the holy C&bhooov;munion within one yeare then last past, shall pay to and for the said first Subsidie eight pence for every poll, and to and for the said second Subsidie eight pence for every poll, And the master or he or shee, with whome the said Alien is or shalbe abiding at the tyme of the taxacion or taxacions thereof to be charged with the same for lacke of payment thereof.

section.head: II. Two Subsidies on Real Estates 4s. in the Pound.
section.para: Aliens, &c. 8s. in the Pound.

And be it further ena&bholigct;ed by the authoritie aforesaid That every &bhopubr;son borne under the King&bholngs; obeisance, and every Corporacion, Fraternitie Guild Misterie Brotherhood, and Commonaltie, corporate or not corporate for every pound that every of the same &bhopubr;sons, and every Corporacion, Fraternitie Guild Misterie Brotherhood & C&bhooov;monaltie corporate or not corporate, or any other to his or their use hath in fee simple fee taile for terme of life terme of yeares by Execucion Wardship or by Coppie of Court Roll of and in any Honors Castles Mannors Land&bholngs; Ten[an]ts Rent&bholngs; s[er]vices Hereditam[en]ts A&bhonov;uities Fees Corrodies or other yearelie proffits of the yearelie value of twentie shillings, as well within auncient demesne and other places priviledged as elsewhere, and so upward, shall pay to and for the said first subsidie, foure shillings of and for every pound and to and for the second Subsidie foure shillings of and for every pound: And every Alien denizen or not denizen borne out of the King&bholngs; obeysance; and every Popish Recusant convi&bholigct;, or which before the tyme of the assessement of the severall Subsidies by this &bhopcrl;sent A&bholigct; graunted, shalbe a Popish Recusant convi&bholigct;, which shalbe indi&bholigct;ed for Popish Recusancie, and their indi&bholigct;ments are or shalbe removed by Cerciorare, in such case to pay to and for the said first Subsidie eight shillings for every pound, And to and for the said second Subsidie eight shillings of every pound.

section.head: III. Plate, &c. held for Corporations to be rated.
section.para: Lands, Corodies, Fees, &c.; Proviso for Ornaments, &c. of Churches and Chappels.

And that all s&bhooov;mes to be &bhopcrl;sented and chargeable by this A&bholigct;, either for good&bholngs; and debt&bholngs;, or either of them, or for Land&bholngs; Tenement&bholngs; and other the &bhopcrl;misses, as is in this A&bholigct; contained, shalbe at every of the said payments, set and taxed after the rate and &bhopubrc;porcion [and1] according to the true meaning of this A&bholigct;; Land&bholngs; and Tenement&bholngs; chargeable to the dismes of the Clergie and yearelie wages due to the servaunts for their yearelie service (other then the King&bholngs;. servaunts taking yearelie wages of five pound&bholngs; or above) onelie excepted and foreprised. And that all Plate, Coyne, Jewells, Good&bholngs;, Debt&bholngs; and Chattell&bholngs; &bhopubr;sonalls, and all Land&bholngs;, Tenement&bholngs;, and other the &bhopcrl;misses as aforesaid, being in the rule and custodie of any &bhopubr;son or &bhopubr;sons to the use of any Corporacion, Fraternitie, Guild, Misterie, Brotherhood, or any Commonaltie, being corporate or not corporate, be, and shalbe rated, set, and charged by reason of this A&bholigct;, at the value certified by the &bhopcrl;senters of that Certificate of every pound in good&bholngs; and debt&bholngs; as is aforesaid, And for every pound in Land&bholngs; Tenement&bholngs; A&bhonov;uities Fees Corrodies, and other yearelie proffitts as is aforesaid, and the s&bhooov;mes that are above rehearsed sett and taxed to be levied and taken of them that shall have such good&bholngs; in custodie, or otherwise charged for Land&bholngs; as is before rehearsed, And the same &bhopubr;son and &bhopubr;sons, and bodies corporate by authoritie of this A&bholigct; shalbe discharged against him or them that shall or ought to have the same at the time of the payment or deliverie thereof, or at his otherwise departure from the custodie or possession of the same: Except and alwaies foreprised from the charge and assessement of the said Subsidies all Good&bholngs; Chattell&bholngs; Jewells and ornaments of Churches and Chappell&bholngs;, which have beene ordayned and used in Churches and Chappell&bholngs; for the honor and service of Almightie God.

section.head: IV. Subsidies when rated in Shires, Towns,&c.
section.para: Names, Places,&c. of Persons liable sent to the Exchequer.; Names of Collectors certified to the Exchequer; Payments in Liberties,&c.

And the said first Subsidie, shalbe by authoritie aforesaid taxed, sessed, and rated according to this A&bholigct;, in every Shire, Riding, Lath, Wapentake, Rape, Citie, Borough, Towne, and every other place within this Realme of England, and Wales, and other the King&bholngs; Dominions before the last day of September now next c&bhooov;ming, And the said second Subsidie, shall by the authoritie aforesaid, be taxed sessed and rated before the last day of March now next ensuing, And the particuler s&bhooov;mes of every Shire Riding, Borough, Towne, and other place aforesaid, with the particular names of such as are or shalbe chargeable, to, and for the payment of the said first Subsidie, to be taxed and sett by the C&bhooov;missioners to the same to be lymitted, or two of them at the least, with the names of the high Colle&bholigct;ors, and in the same forme shalbe certified into the King&bholngs; Exchequer, before the twentith day of O&bholigct;ober next c&bhooov;ming: And the particuler s&bhooov;mes of every Shire, Riding, Borough, Towne, and other places aforesaid, with the particular names of such as are chargeable for the said second Subsidie to be taxed and sett by the C&bhooov;missioners to the same to be lymitted or two of them at the least, with the names of the high Colle&bholigct;ors, and in the same forme shalbe certified into the King&bholngs; Exchequer, before the twentith of Aprill now next c&bhooov;ming, And the said s&bhooov;mes in forme aforesaid to be taxed to and for the payment of the said first Subsidie, shalbe paid in one entire s&bhooov;me into the King&bholngs; receipt of Exchequer aforesaid to the use of our said Soveraigne Lord, at or before the last day of O&bholigct;ober now next c&bhooov;ming, And the said s&bhooov;mes in manner and forme aforesaid, to be taxed for the payment of the said second Subsidie shalbe paid in one entire s&bhooov;me into the receipt aforesaid, to the use aforesaid at or before the last day of Aprill now next c&bhooov;ming, And the s&bhooov;mes abovesaid, of and for the said Subsidies shalbe taxed, set, asked, and demaunded, taken, gathered, levied, and paid to the use of our said Soveraigne Lord his Heires and Successors in forme aforesaid, as well within Liberties Franchesies San&bholigct;uaries Auncient demesnes and other whatsoever places exempt or not exempt, as without, except such Shires places and &bhopubr;sons as shalbe foreprised in and by this &bhopcrl;sent A&bholigct;, any Grant Charter &bhopcrl;scripcion, Use or Libertie, by reason of any l[ia]res patents, or other priviledge &bhopcrl;scripcion, allowance for the same, or whatsoever other matter or discharge heretofore to the contrary made, granted, used, or obtayned notwithstanding.

section.head: V. Absentees whether Natives or Aliens charged by Certificate of Inhabitant of Place where Lands,&c. be.
section.para: Rule by which they are to be charged.

And it is further ena&bholigct;ed by the authoritie of this &bhopcrl;sent Parliament, That every such &bhopubr;son aswell such as be borne under the King&bholngs; obeysance, as every other &bhopubr;son Stranger borne, Denizen or not Denizen, inhabiting within this Realme, or within Wales, or other the King&bholngs; Dominions, which at the tyme of the same assesings or Taxacions or ev[er]y of them to be had or made, shalbe out of this Realme, or out of Wales, and have good&bholngs; chattell&bholngs; land&bholngs; [and2] tenement&bholngs; fees or a&bhonov;uities, or other proffitts within this Realme, or in Wales shalbe charged and chargeable for the same by the Certificate of the inhabitants of the place where such good&bholngs; chattell&bholngs; land&bholngs; tenement&bholngs; or other the &bhopcrl;misses then shalbe, or in such other place where such &bhopubr;son or &bhopubr;sons, or his or their Fa&bholigct;or Deputie, or Attorny shall have their most resort unto, within this Realme or in Wales, in like manner as if the said &bhopubr;son were or had byn at the tyme of the said assessing within this Realme: And that every &bhopubr;son abiding or dwelling [within3] or without this Realme, shalbe charged or chargeable to the same Subsidies graunted by this A&bholigct;, according and after the rate of such yearelie substance, or value of land&bholngs;, or tenement&bholngs; good&bholngs; chattell&bholngs; and other the &bhopcrl;misses, as every &bhopubr;son so to be charged, shalbe set at, the tyme of the said assessing or taxacion upon him to be made and no otherwise.

section.head: VI. Commissioners to be appointed by Lord Chancellor, Lord Treasurer, and other great Officers.
section.para: Commissioners for Boroughs and Towns Corporate, not being Counties, not to execute A&bholigct; out of their Boroughs or Towns.; Penalty.; Certificate thereof by the other Commissioners to the Exchequer.

And be it further ena&bholigct;ed by the authoritie aforesaid that for the assessing and ordering of the said two Subsidies to be dulie had the Lord Chauncellor of England, or the Lord Keep of the Great Seale, the Lord Treasurer of England, the Lord President of the King&bholngs; Councell, the Lord Privie Seale, the Lord Steward of the King&bholngs; houshold, the Lord Admirall of England, the Lord Chamberlaine of the King&bholngs; most honorable Houshold for the tyme being or two of them at the least (whereof the Lord Chauncellor of England, or Keep of the Greate Seale for the tyme being to be one) shall and may name and appoint of and for every Shire Riding and other places, aswell within this Realme as in Wales, and other the King&bholngs; Dominions, as also of and for every Citie and Towne being a Countie of it selfe, and of and for the Isle of Wight, such certaine nomber of &bhopubr;sons of every of the same Shires Ridings Lathes Wapentakes Rapes Cities Townes and Isle of Wight and every other place, as they shall thinke convenient to be C&bhooov;missioners of and within the same place whereof they be Inhabitants: and also of and for the honorable houshold of the King&bholngs; Majestie, in what Shire or other place the said houshold shall [then happen4] to be, And the Lord Chauncellor or Lord Keep of the great Seale for the tyme being, and other with him before named, or two of them as is aforesaid in like manner may name and appoint of every other such Borough, Townes corporate, as well in England as in Wales, and other the King&bholngs; Dominions, as they shall thinke fitt and requisite, six, five, foure, three or two of the head Officers, and other honest inhabitants in every of the said Cities Boroughes and Townes corporate, according to the nomber and multitude of the people being in the same, The which &bhopubr;sons (if any such be) thereunto named of the said Inhabitants of the said Boroughs and Townes corporate, not being Counties of themselves, shalbe joyned and putt in as C&bhooov;missioners, with the &bhopubr;sons named for such Shires and Ridings, as the said Boroughes and Townes corporate, not being Counties in themselves, be set and have their being: which &bhopubr;sons so named for and of the said Boroughs and Townes corporate, not being Counties, by reason of their dwelling in the same, shall not take uppon them, nor none of them to put any part of their C&bhooov;mission in execucion for the &bhopcrl;misses out of the said Boroughs and Townes corporate wherein they be so named onelie, nor to execute the said C&bhooov;mission within the Borough or Towne corporate where they shalbe so dwelling, but at such daies and tymes as the said other C&bhooov;missioners for the same Shire and Riding shall thereunto lymitt and appoint within the said Borough and Towne corporate not being a Countie, whereof they be so named, and not out of such Borough or Towne, and in that manner to be ayding and assisting with the said other C&bhooov;missioners, in and for the good executing of the effe&bholigct; of the said C&bhooov;mission, uppon paine of every of the said C&bhooov;missioners soe named, for every such Citie Borough and Towne corporate, not being a Countie, to make such Fine as the said other C&bhooov;missioners in the C&bhooov;mission of and for the same Shire or Riding so named, or three of them at the least, shall by their discrecions sett and certifie into the King&bholngs; Exchequer, there to be levied to the use of the King&bholngs; Majestie in like manner as if such or like s&bhooov;mes had byn sett and rated uppon every such &bhopubr;son for the said Subsidies.
Commissions dire&bholigct;ed out of Chancery; Schedules to Commissions.; Commissioners to divide themselves.; Commissioners not compellable to a&bholigct; out of Shires.

The which C&bhooov;missioners soe named of and for the said Citties, Boroughs and Townes not being Counties, and onelie put into the said C&bhooov;mission by reason of their dwelling in the same, shall not have any part or porcion of the Fees and rewards of the C&bhooov;missioners and their Clerks in this A&bholigct; afterwards specified and allowed, And the Lord Chauncellor of England or Keep of the greate Seale of England for the tyme being, shall make and dire&bholigct; out of the Court of Chauncery under the great Seale severall C&bhooov;missions: That is to saie, For every Shire Riding Lath Wapentake Rape Citie Towne Borough Isle and houshold unto such &bhopubr;son and &bhopubr;sons as by his discrecion, or any of the other with him before named and appointed, as is before rehearsed shalbe thought sufficient for the sessing and levying of the said two Subsidies in all Shires and places, according to the true meaning of this A&bholigct;e: which C&bhooov;mission for the payment of the said first Subsidie shalbe dire&bholigct;ed and delivered to the said C&bhooov;missioners, or to one of them, before the last day of August next c&bhooov;ming, And the C&bhooov;mission for the payment of the said second Subsidie shalbe dire&bholigct;ed and delivered to the said C&bhooov;missioners, or to one of them before the last day of Februarie next c&bhooov;ming, And to every of the said C&bhooov;missions tenne Schedules conteyning in them the tenor of this A&bholigct; shalbe affiled: By the which C&bhooov;mission, the C&bhooov;missioners in every such C&bhooov;mission named according to this A&bholigct;e, and as many of them as shalbe appointed by the said C&bhooov;mission shall have full power and authoritie to putt the effe&bholigct; of the said C&bhooov;mission in Execucion: And that by the authoritie of this A&bholigct;, after such C&bhooov;mission to them dire&bholigct;ed they may by their assents and agreements sever themselves for the execucion of their C&bhooov;mission, in Hundreds Lathes, Wards, Rapes, Wapentakes, Townes, Parishes, and other places within the lymitts of the said C&bhooov;mission, in such forme as to them shall seeme expedient to be ordered, and betweene them to be c&bhooov;muned and agreed, according to the tenor and effe&bholigct; of the C&bhooov;mission to them therein dire&bholigct;ed, Uppon which severance every &bhopubr;son of this &bhopcrl;sent Parliament that shalbe C&bhooov;missioner shalbe assigned unto the Hundred where he dwelleth. Provided alwaies that no &bhopubr;son be or shalbe compelled to be any C&bhooov;missioner to and for the execucion of this &bhopcrl;sent A&bholigct;, but onelie in the Shire where he dwelleth and inhabiteth. And that any &bhopubr;son assigned to the contrary thereof in any wise, shall not be compelled to put in execucion the effe&bholigct; of this A&bholigct; or any part thereof.

section.head: VII. Commissioners to execute. A&bholigct; according to the tenor thereof.
section.para: Commissioners to direv&bholigct; Precepts to certain number of Inhabitants in Hundreds,&c. to appear before Commissioners.; Persons who receive Precepts are to shew such Precepts to the other Inhabitants named therein.; Penalty 40s.

And be it alsoe ena&bholigct;ed by the authoritie of this &bhopcrl;sent Parliament, That the C&bhooov;missioners and every of them which shalbe named lymitted and appointed according to this A&bholigct; to be C&bhooov;missioners in every such Shire Riding Lathe Wapentake Rape Citie Towne Borough Isle and the said houshold, or any other place, and none other, shall trulie effe&bholigct;uallie and diligentlie for their part execute the effe&bholigct; of this &bhopcrl;sent A&bholigct;, according to the tenor thereof in every behalfe, and no otherwise by any other meanes without omission, favour, dread, malice, or any other thing to be attempted or done by them or any of them to the contrary thereof, And the said C&bhooov;missioners, or as many of them as shalbe appointed by the said C&bhooov;mission, and none other, for the execucion of the said C&bhooov;mission and A&bholigct;, shall for the taxacion of the said first Subsidie, before the twentith day of September next ensuing; And for the Taxacion of the said second Subsidie, shall before the twentith [day5] of March next c&bhooov;ming by vertue of the C&bhooov;mission delivered unto them in forme [aforesaid,6] dire&bholigct; their severall or joynt&bhopcrl;cept or &bhopcrl;cepts unto eight, seaven, sixe, five, foure, three or two, as for the nomber of the Inhabitants shalbe requisite of the most substanciall discreet and honest &bhopubr;sons inhabitants to be named by the said C&bhooov;missioners, or by as many of them as shalbe appointed by the said C&bhooov;mission of and in Hundreds Lathes Rapes Wapentakes Wards Parishes Townes and other places aswell within Liberties, Franchesies, Auncient demesne, places exempted and San&bholigct;uaries, as without, within the lymitts of the Shires, Ridings, Lathes, Wapentakes, Rapes, Citties, Townes, Boroughs, and Isle aforesaid, and other Places within the lymitts of their C&bhooov;mission, and to the Constables, Subconstables, Bailiffs and other like Officers and Ministers of every of the said Hundreds, Townes, Wards, Lathes, Wapentakes, Parishes and other Places aforesaid, as to the said Commissioners and every nomber of them or unto three or two of them by their discrecion in division shall seeme expedient, as by the manner and use of those part&bholngs;, shalbe requisite, straitlie by the said &bhopcrl;cept charging and c&bhooov;maunding the said Inhabitants Constables and other Officers aforesaid, to whome such &bhopcrl;cept shalbe so dire&bholigct;ed to appeare in their &bhopubrc;per &bhopubr;sons before the said C&bhooov;missioners or such nomber of them, as they shall divide themselves, according to the tenor of the said C&bhooov;mission at certaine daies and places by the said C&bhooov;missioners or any nomber of them as is aforesaid, within Cities Boroughs or Townes corporate or without in any other Places as is aforesaid, by their discrecion shalbe lymitted thereunto, to doe and accomplish all that to them on the part of the King&bholngs; Majestie shalbe enjoyned touching this A&bholigct;: C&bhooov;maunding further by the same &bhopcrl;cept, that hee to whose hand&bholngs; such &bhopcrl;cept shall come, shall shew and deliver the same to the other Inhabitants or Officers named in the same &bhopcrl;cept, And that none of them faile to accomplish the same uppon paine of fortie shillings to be forfeited to the King&bholngs; Majestie.

section.head: VIII. Persons named in Precept to appear before Commissioners.
section.para: Such Persons making Default or refusing to serve.; Penalty 40s. ; Upon Appearance charged to make enquiry into the Substance of Persons to be charged, but such Enquiry not to be taken on Oath, and to certify before Commissioners.; Penalty £5. or more.; Commissioners to read the Rates openly.; Afterwards another Day appointed by Commissioners for such Persons to appear.; Not appearing.; Penalty 40s.; or refusing to make Certificate.; Penalty 40s.; Commissioners to examine Presenters of Certificate.; Further Proceedings on Assessments by Precept to Constables,&c. to warn Persons named therein to appear.; Oath not allowed on Enquiry into the Substance of Persons charged.; Persons named in the said Precept called upon not appearing.; Penalty double Rate.; On Enquiry into the Substance of Persons charged, Commissioners may increase Taxation.

And it is further ordeyned by the Authoritie of this &bhopcrl;sent Parliament, that at the said day and place &bhopcrl;fixed and lymitted in the said &bhopcrl;cept, every of the said C&bhooov;missioners then being in the Shire, and not having sufficient excuse for his absence, at the day and place &bhopcrl;fixed for that part whereunto he was lymitted, shall appeare in his owne &bhopubrc;per &bhopubr;son, and there the same C&bhooov;missioners being &bhopcrl;sent or as many of them as shalbe appointed by the King&bholngs; Majesties C&bhooov;mission, shall call or cause to be called before them the said Inhabitants and officers to whome they have dire&bholigct;ed their said &bhopcrl;cepts, and which had in c&bhooov;maundement there to appeare by vertue of the said &bhopcrl;cept. And if any &bhopubr;son so warned make default, unlesse he then be letted by sicknes or lawfull excuse, and that lett be then witnessed by the oathes of two credible &bhopubr;sons, or if any appearing refuse to serve in forme following, Then every such &bhopubr;son so making default or refusing to serve shall forfeit to the King&bholngs; Majestie fortie shillings, and so at every tyme appointed by the saide C&bhooov;missioners for the same Taxacion, untill such Tyme the nomber of every such &bhopubr;sons have appeared and certified in forme underwritten, every of them so making default or refusing to serve, shall forfeit to the King&bholngs; Majestie fortie shillings, and uppon the same appearance had, they shalbe charged before the C&bhooov;missioners by all convenient waies and meanes (other then: by corporall Oath) to enquire of the best and most value of the substance of every &bhopubr;son dwelling and abiding within the lymitts of the places that they shalbe charged with, and of other which shall have his or their most resort unto any of the said places and chargeable with any s&bhouov;me of mony by this A&bholigct;e of the said [Subsidies7] and of all other thing&bholngs; requisite touching the said A&bholigct;, and according to the intent of the same, and thereuppon as neere as it may be or shall come to their knowledge, without respe&bholigct; of any former taxacion heretofore had, trulie to &bhopcrl;sent and certifie before the said C&bhooov;missioners the names and surnames, and the best and uttermost substance and values of every of them, as well of Landes Tenement&bholngs; and other Hereditament&bholngs; Possessions and Proffitts, as of goodes chattell&bholngs; debt&bholngs; and other thing&bholngs; chargeable by the same A&bholigct;, without any concealement, love, favour, affeccion, dread or malice, uppon paine of forfeiture of five pound&bholngs; or more, to be taxed, extra&bholigct;ed, and levied in forme as hereafter in this &bhopcrl;sent A&bholigct; shall be lymitted or appointed: and thereuppon the said C&bhooov;missioners shall openlie there read, or cause to be read unto them the said rates in this A&bholigct; mencioned, and openlie declare the effe&bholigct; of their charge unto them in what manner and forme they ought and should make their certificates according to the rates and s&bhooov;mes thereof abovesaid, and of all manner of &bhopubr;sons aswell Aliens and Strangers Denizens or not Denizens inhabiting within this Realme, as of such &bhopubr;sons as be borne under the King&bholngs; obeisance chargeable to this A&bholigct;, and of the possessions goodes and chattell&bholngs; of Fraternities Guilds Corporacions Brotherhoods Misteries C&bhooov;monalties, and other as is abovesaid, and of &bhopubr;sons being in the part&bholngs; beyond the Seas, having Good&bholngs; and Chattell&bholngs; Land&bholngs; or Tenement&bholngs; within this Realme as is aforesaid, and of all good&bholngs; being in the Custodie of any &bhopubr;son or &bhopubr;sons, to the use of any other as is abovesaid, by the which Informacion and shewing, the said &bhopubr;sons should have such plaine knowledge of the true intent of this &bhopcrl;sent A&bholigct;, and of the manner of their Certificate, That the same &bhopubr;sons shall have no reasonable cause to excuse them by ignorance. And after such charge, and the Statute of the said [Subsidies8] and the manner of the said Certificate to be made in writing, conteyning the names and surnames of every &bhopubr;son, and whether he be borne without the King&bholngs; obeysance, or Within, and the best value of every &bhopubr;son, in every degree, aswell of the yearelie value of Land&bholngs; and Tenement&bholngs;, and of such like possessions and proffitts, as of the value of good&bholngs; and chattell&bholngs; debt&bholngs; and every thing to their certificate requisite and necessary to them declared, the said C&bhooov;missioners there being, shalby their discrecions lymitt and appoint unto the said &bhopubr;sons another day and place to appeare before the said C&bhooov;missioners, and charging the said &bhopubr;sons, that they in the meane tyme shall make diligent inquirie by all waies and meanes of the &bhopcrl;misses, and then and there every of them uppon paine of forfeiture of fortie shillings to the King&bholngs; Majestie, to appeare att the said new &bhopcrl;fixed day and place there to certifie unto the said C&bhooov;missioners in writing according to their said charge and according to the true intent of the said Graunt of Subsidie and as to them in manner aforesaid hath bene declared and shewed by the C&bhooov;missioners, Att which daie and place so to them &bhopcrl;fixed, if anie of the said &bhopubr;sons make default, or appeare and refuse to make the said Certificate that then everie of them so offending, to forfeite to the King&bholngs; Majestie fortie shillings except there be a reasonable excuse of his default, by reason of his sicknes or otherwise by the oathes of two credible &bhopubr;sons there witnessed, and of such as appeare readie to make Certificate as is aforesaid, the said C&bhooov;missioners there being, shall take and receave the same Certificate and every part thereof, and the names values and substance of everie &bhopubr;son so certified And if the said C&bhooov;missioners see cause reasonable they shall examine the said Presenters thereof, and thereupon the said C&bhooov;missioners att the said daies and place by their agreement amongest themselves, shall from time to time there openlie &bhopcrl;fixe a day at a certaine place or places within the limitts of their C&bhooov;mission by their discrecion for their further &bhopubrc;ceeding to the said Assessing of the same [Subsidies,9] And thereuppon att the said day of the said Certificate, as is aforesaid taken, the same C&bhooov;missioners shall make their &bhopcrl;cept or &bhopcrl;cepts to the Constables Subconstables Bailiffs or other Officers of such Hundreds Wapentakes Townes or other places aforesaid as the same C&bhooov;missioners shalbe of comprysing and conteyning in the said &bhopcrl;cepts the names and surnames of all &bhopubr;sons &bhopcrl;sented before them in the said Certificate, of whome if the said C&bhooov;missioners or as many of them as shalbe thereunto appointed by the King&bholngs; C&bhooov;mission shall then have vehement suspe&bholigct; to be of more greater value or substance in Land&bholngs; Good&bholngs; Chattell&bholngs; or s&bhooov;mes of money owing unto them or other substance aforesaid then uppon such &bhopubr;son or &bhopubr;sons soe certified and specified as aforesaid, the same C&bhooov;missioners shall make their &bhopcrl;cepts or &bhopcrl;cept dire&bholigct;ed to the Constables Bailiffs or other Officers c&bhooov;manding the said Constables Bayliffs or other officers to whome such &bhopcrl;cept shalbe dire&bholigct;ed to warne such &bhopubr;sons whose names shalbe comprised in the said &bhopcrl;cepts att their mansions, or to their &bhopubr;sons, that the same &bhopubr;sons named in such &bhopcrl;cepts and everie of them shall &bhopubr;sonallie appeare before the said C&bhooov;missioners at the said new &bhopcrl;fixed day and place there to be examined by all waies and meanes (other then by corporall oath) by the said C&bhooov;missioners of their greatest substance and best value, and of all and everie somes of money owing to them and other whatsoever matter con&bhoccrl;ning the &bhopcrl;misses or anie of them according to this A&bholigct;. At which day and place so &bhopcrl;fixed the said C&bhooov;missioners then and there being, or as many of them as shalbe thereunto appointed by the King&bholngs; C&bhooov;mission, shall cause to be called the said &bhopubr;sons whose names shalbe comprised in the said &bhopcrl;cept as is aforesaid for their examinacion, And if anie of [these10] &bhopubr;sons which shalbe warned as aforesaid to be examined, which at anie time after the warning, and before the day &bhopcrl;fixed shalbe within such place as he may have knowledge of his said appearance to be made make default and appeare not, unlesse a reasonable cause, or els a reasonable excuse by the oathes of two credible &bhopubr;sons, before the said C&bhooov;missioners, be truelie alleaged for his discharge, that then everie of them so making default to be taxed and charged to the King&bholngs; Majestie, with and at the double s&bhooov;me of the rate, that he should or ought to have bene sett att, for and after the best value of his landes or substance uppon him &bhoccrl;tified if he had appeared by the discrecion of the C&bhooov;missioners there being which Commissioners shall travaile with every of the other &bhopubr;sons soe then and there appearing, whose names shalbe ex&bhopcrl;ssed in the said &bhopcrl;cept or &bhopcrl;cepts and in whome anie vehement suspe&bholigct; was or shalbe had in forme aforesaid by all such waies and meanes they can, other then by corporall oath for the better knowledge of their best value, either in hereditament&bholngs; or possessions, or els in good&bholngs; or debt&bholngs; and thereuppon shall have power and authoritie by virtue of this A&bholigct; according to their discrecions to enlarge and increase the taxa&bhocotil;n of such &bhopubr;sons as they shall soe find by due examinacion to be of greater value or substance in landes or goodes, then the were &bhopcrl;sented att.

section.head: IX. Spiritual Persons how rated for Temporal Possessions.
section.para: And that everie Spirituall &bhopubr;son at everie of the said taxacions of the said two Subsidies, shalbe rated and sett according to the rate abovesaid, of and for everie pound that the same Spirituall &bhopubr;son, or anie other to his use, hath by discent bargaine or purchase in Fee simple, or fee taile, terme of life, terme of yeres, by execucion, by wardshipp, or by coppie of court Roll, in anie mannors land&bholngs; tenement&bholngs; rent&bholngs; services offices fees corrodies a&bhonov;uities and hereditament&bholngs; after the true just and yereley value thereof and according as other the King&bholngs; Majesties Subje&bholigct;&bholngs; borne within this Realme be charged in forme above remembred, soe that it extend to the yereley value of twentie shillings or above.

section.head: X. Assessors misbehaving.
section.para: Commissioners may set a Fine upon them; estreated into the Exchequer.

And it is further ena&bholigct;ed That if the said Taxors or Assessors shall not dulie behave themselves in their inquirie, taxacion, Assessement, or Certificate, but shall affeccionately corruptlie or parciallie demeane themselves in that behalfe, in such wise, that the C&bhooov;missioners shalby their consideracions deeme them offenders worthie of punishment, for not doeing their duties therein, that then foure or more of the C&bhooov;missioners in that Countie for the said Subsidie, shall have power and authoritie by their discrecions either to charge the said Assessors uppon their corporall oathes, for the better service aforesaid in that behalfe, or els by their discrecions to taxe and sett uppon the said Assessors for their misdemeanors in that behalfe, such a fine or paine as they shall thincke good, soe that it exceed not the s&bhooov;me of ten pound&bholngs;, and the same fine or paine att their discrecions to estreat into the Courte of Exchequer: Everie which Fine soe taxed and sett, by foure of the said C&bhooov;missioners or more, and being estreated with the Schedule and Bookes of that limitt shalbe levied and answered to the King&bholngs; use in [like11] manner, and forme to all intent&bholngs; and purposes, as anie other s&bhooov;mes that shalbe taxed and become due by virtue of this Statute and A&bholigct; of Subsidie, and not in any other wise or manner.

section.head: XI. Remedy for Persons aggrieved by the Assessment.
section.para: Commissioners may abate or increase Assessment.; False Oath of Value of Lands,&c.; Penalty.

And if anie &bhopubr;son certified or rated by virtue of this A&bholigct; whether he be a C&bhooov;missioner or other to anie manner of value doth find himselfe greived with the same &bhopcrl;sentment, sessing or rating, and thereuppon complaine to the C&bhooov;missioners before whome he shalbe called sessed or taxed, or before two of them before the same taxacion be certified in the Court of Exchequer that then the said C&bhooov;missioners, or two of them, shall by all waies and meanes examine particularlie and distin&bholigct;lie the &bhopubr;son so complayning uppon his oath and other his neighbours by their discrecions of every his Land&bholngs; and Tenement&bholngs; above specified, and of every his good&bholngs; chattell&bholngs; and debt&bholngs; above mencioned: And after due examinacion and &bhopubr;fe&bholigct; knowledge thereof had and &bhopcrl;ceived by the said C&bhooov;missioners, or two of them, which shall have power by authoritie aforesaid, the said C&bhooov;missioners or two of them, to whome any such complaint shalbe made, by their discrecion uppon the oath of the said &bhopubr;son so complayning may abate, defaulke, increase or inlarge the said assessements, according as it shall appeare unto them just uppon the same examinacion, and the same s&bhooov;me so abated, defaulked, increased, or inlarged, shall be by them estreated in forme as hereafter ensueth. And if it be proved by witnesses, or by the parties owne confession, or other lawfull waie or meanes, within a yeare after any such oath made, that the same &bhopubr;son so rated and sworne, was of any better or greater value in land&bholngs; goodes or other thing&bholngs; above specified at the tyme of his said oath, then the same &bhopubr;son so sworne did declare uppon his said oath, that then every such &bhopubr;son so offending shall lose and forfeit to the King&bholngs; Majestie so much lawfull mony of England, as he the same &bhopubr;son so sworne was set at or taxed to pay.

section.head: XII. Commissioners to be rated at such Place where they shall be Commissioners; other Persons where they have resided for the most Part of the Year preceding.
section.para: Absentees assessed where last abiding.; Rate to be according to the Substance of Persons liable.

And also it is ena&bholigct;ed by the same authoritie, that every &bhopubr;son to be rated and taxed as is aforesaid, shalbe rated and set, and the s&bhooov;me on him set to be levied at such place, where he and his familie were resident for the most part of the yeare next before the same &bhopcrl;sentment and taxacion made, and no where else. And that no C&bhooov;mission[er] for his Subsidie shall be rated or taxed for his good&bholngs; or land&bholngs;, but in the Shire or in other place where he shalbe C&bhooov;missioner. And that if any &bhopubr;son chargeable to this A&bholigct;, at the tyme of the said assessings happen to be out of this Realme, and out of Wales, or farre from the place where he shalbe knowen: then he to be set, where he was last abiding in this Realme, or within Wales, and after the substance, value, and other proffitts of every &bhopubr;son, to be knowen by the examinacion, certificate or other manner of way as is aforesaid, And that the said C&bhooov;missioners, or as many of them as shalbe appointed by the King&bholngs; Majesties C&bhooov;mission or C&bhooov;missions shall after the rate and rates aforesaid cause every &bhopubr;son so to be set rated and taxed, according to the rate of the substance and value of his land&bholngs; goodes chattell&bholngs; and other &bhopubrc;ffitts chargeable by this A&bholigct;, whereby the greatest or most best s&bhooov;me or s&bhooov;mes according to his most substance, by reason of this A&bholigct; might or may be set or taxed.

section.head: XIII. Remedy for Commissioners and other Persons taxed in other Place than where they are Commissioners or were resiant for most Part of the preceding Year.
section.para: Fee for Allowance.

And that every &bhopubr;son taxed in any Countie or Place, other then where he and his family were resiant for the most part of the yeare, then next before, or in any Countie or place, other then where he is a C&bhooov;missioner for the Subsidie, if he be a C&bhooov;missioner, uppon certificate made to the said Court of Exchequer under the hand&bholngs; and seales of two C&bhooov;missioners for the same Subsidie in the same Countie or place where such &bhopubr;son and his family were resiant for the most part of the yeare then next before, or where he is a C&bhooov;missioner for the taxacion and payment of the same Subsidie, testifying his most resiance, having of familie, or being a C&bhooov;missioner, shalbe a sufficient discharge for the taxacion of that &bhopubr;son in any other places, and of and for all other s&bhooov;mes of mony uppon such &bhopubr;sons so set and taxed, save only the taxacions made in that Countie or place from which such certificate shall be made as is aforesaid, and for the s&bhooov;me of mony uppon such &bhopubr;son there assessed or taxed, And that such certificate without any Plea or other circumstance, shalbe a sufficient warrant aswell to the Barons and Auditor and Auditors of the said Court of Exchequer, as to all and every other Officers, to whome the allowance thereof shall appertaine, paying for such discharge and allowance onelie six pence and no more.

section.head: XIV. Double Charges not to be allowed.
section.para: Remedy in respe&bholigct; of Double Charges.

Provided alwaies, that every such &bhopubr;son that shall be rated or taxed according to the intent and true meaning of this A&bholigct; for paying of and to these Subsidies for and after the yearelie value of his Land&bholngs; Tenement&bholngs;, and other reall possessions or proffitts, at any of the said taxacions, shall not after be sett and rated for his good&bholngs; and chattell&bholngs;, or other moveable substance at the same taxacion, and that he that shalbe sett charged or taxed for the same Subsidies for his goodes chattell&bholngs; and other moveables at any of the said taxacions according to the true meaning of this A&bholigct;, shall not after be charged taxed or chargeable for his land&bholngs; or other reall possessions and proffitts abovesaid at the same taxacions or any of them, nor that any &bhopubr;son by any taxacion be double charged for the said Subsidies, nor set or taxed at severall places by reason of this A&bholigct;, But if any &bhopubr;son happen to be double set taxed or charged, either in one place, or at severall places, then he to be discharged of the one taxacion, and charged with the other, according to the meaning and intent of this A&bholigct;, any thing contayned in this &bhopcrl;sent A&bholigct; to the contrary notwithstanding.

section.head: XV. Proviso for Persons having two Mansions, or being Houshold Servants or Waiting Servants to the King or others.
section.para: Persons unduly escaping Taxation,; on Proof thereof before Commissioners or Barons of the Exchequer,; taxed at Double Value.

And that it be ordeyned and ena&bholigct;ed by the said authoritie of this &bhopcrl;sent Parliament, That no &bhopubr;son having two Mansions, or two places to resort unto, or calling himselfe Houshold servant, or waiting servant to the King&bholngs; Majestie, or other Lord or Lady, Master or Mistresse, be excused uppon his saying, from the taxes of the said Subsidies, in neither of the places, where he may be set or taxed, unlesse he bring a Certificate in writing from the C&bhooov;missioners where that he is so set or taxed indeed at one place. And if any &bhopubr;son that ought to be set and taxed to these &bhopcrl;sent Subsidies by reason of his removing or resorting to two places, or by reason of his saying that he elsewhere was taxed, or by reason of any priviledge of his dwelling or abiding in any place not being foreprised in this A&bholigct;, or otherwise by his covine or crafte, or by any words or sayings or otherwise: or if any that is a C&bhooov;missioner or Assessor of others, happen to escape from the said taxacions for the payment of these Subsidies, or any of them, and be not set and taxed according to the true intent of this A&bholigct;, and that proved by &bhopcrl;sentment, Examinacion, Informacion, or otherwise before the said C&bhooov;missioners, or two of them, or before the Barons of the King&bholngs; Mats Exchequer, or two Justices of the Peace of that Countie where such &bhopubr;son dwelleth: Then every such &bhopubr;son that by such meanes or otherwise, willinglie by covin or without just cause, shall happen to escape from the said taxacions or payments aforesaid or any of them, and shall not be rated taxed and set shall be charged upon the knowledge and proofe thereof, with, and at the double value of so much as he should, might or ought to have bene set or taxed at by vertue of this A&bholigct;: And the same double value to be levied gathered and paid of his Good&bholngs; and Chattell&bholngs;, Land&bholngs; and Tenement&bholngs; towards the said Subsidies, and further to be punished according to the discrecion of the Barons, Justices and C&bhooov;missioners, before whome he shalbe convi&bholigct;ed for his offence and deceit in that behalfe.

section.head: XVI. The Power of Commissioners to tax other Commissioners, and also Assessors.
section.para: Barons and Persons of higher Estate taxed by the Lord Chancellor, Lord Treasurer, and other Persons named by the King.; Rate estreated and certified.

And be it further ena&bholigct;ed by the authoritie aforesaid, That the said C&bhooov;missioners in every C&bhooov;mission, which shalbe or inhabite in any Countie or Place within the lymitts of their C&bhooov;mission, or the more part of them, shall have full power and authoritie by this A&bholigct; to set taxe and sesse every other C&bhooov;missioner joyned with them in every such C&bhooov;mission, and the said C&bhooov;missioners within their Division shall also assesse every Assessor within their Division, for his or their good&bholngs; land&bholngs; and other the &bhopcrl;misses as is abovesaid, by which [said12] C&bhooov;mission the said C&bhooov;missioners, to whome it shall appertaine, shall indifferentlie set taxe and sesse themselves and the said Assessors.; and that aswell the s&bhooov;mes uppon every of the said C&bhooov;missioners and Assessors so sessed rated and taxed as the s&bhouov;mes made and &bhopcrl;sented by the Presenters, as is abovesaid, shalbe written certified, set and estreated, and the Estreats thereof to be made with other the inhabitants of that part, and within the lymitts of the same C&bhooov;mission and Division, so to be gathered and levied, in like manner as it ought or should have bene, if the said C&bhooov;missioners had not bene in the said C&bhooov;mission, And that all &bhopubr;sons of the estate of a Baron or Baronesse, and every estate above shalbe charged with their freehold and value as is aforesaid by the Chauncellor or the Lord Keeper of the great Seale of England, the High Treasurer of England for the tyme being or one of them, together with other such &bhopubr;sons as by the King&bholngs; Majesties authoritie or c&bhooov;maundement shalbe named and appointed, and they to be charged for the said severall payments of the said Subsidies after the forme of the said Graunt according to the taxacion aforesaid and the s&bhooov;me of and uppon them to be taxed and set with the names of the Colle&bholigct;ors appointed for gathering and paying of the same, to be estreated delivered and certified at dayes and places above specified by the Lord Chauncellor or Keep of the great Seale, and Lord Tresurer, or one of them, together with other such &bhopubr;sons, as thereunto shalbe named, as is aforesaid.

section.head: XVII. Rates estreated under the Sign Manual and Seal of the Commissioners, and Estreat delivered to sufficient; Inhabitants,&c. of Hundreds,&c.
section.para: By virtue of Estreat Officers,&c. to levy Rate.; Distress.; If Rate not paid in Eight Days then Distress appraised and sold.; Officers,&c. to answer for the Portion limited to them, only.

And be it further ena&bholigct;ed by the authoritie aforesaid, That after the taxes and assesses of the said s&bhooov;mes uppon and by the said assessing and certificate as is aforesaid made, the said C&bhooov;missioners or as many of them as shalbe thereunto appointed, and have authoritie by the King&bholngs; Majesties C&bhooov;mission, shall with all speed, and without delay by their writing estreate the said taxes thereof, under the Seales and Signes Manuell of the said C&bhooov;missioners, or as many of them as shalbe appointed at the least. and the same shall deliver unto sufficient and substanciall Inhabitants, Constables, Subconstables, Bayliffs, and other Officers joyntlie of Hundreds, Townes, Parishes, and other Places aforesaid within their lymitts, and to other sufficient &bhopubr;sons, Inhabitants of the same, onelie by the [discrecions13] of the said C&bhooov;missioners, with the assent of the high Colle&bholigct;or, and as the place and parties shall require, aswell the particuler names& surnames, as the remembrance of all [s&bhooov;mes14] taxed and sett of and uppon every &bhopubr;sons, aswell man as woman chargeable to this A&bholigct;e, Housholders and all other Inhabitants and Dwellers within the said Parishes, Townes and Places contributorie to this A&bholigct; of Subsidies, by authoritie of which writing and estreat so delivered, the said Officers and other &bhopubr;sons so named and deputed, severally shall have full power and authoritie by vertue of this A&bholigct;, imediatelie after the delivery of the said writing or estreat, to demaund levie and gather of every &bhopubr;son therein specified the s&bhouov;me and s&bhouov;mes in the same writing or estreat comprised, and for non payment thereof, to distreine the same &bhopubr;son or &bhopubr;sons so being behinde, by their good&bholngs; and chattell&bholngs;, and the distresse so taken to keepe by the space of eight daies, at the costs and charges of the owner thereof, And if the said owner do not pay such s&bhooov;me of money as shalbe taxed by authoritie of this A&bholigct; within the same eight daies, then the same distresse to be appraised by foure or three or two of the inhabitants where such distresse is taken, and also then to be sold by the Constable or other Colle&bholigct;or for the payment of the said money, and the overplus c&bhooov;ming of the sale and keeping thereof (if any be) to be imediatelie restored to the owner of the same distresse, Which said Officers and other &bhopubr;sons so deputed to aske, take, gather and levie the said s&bhooov;mes, shall aunswere and be charged for the porcion onelie
Allowance to Officers on Rate recovered.

to them assigned and lymitted to be gathered levied and comprised in the said writing or estreat, so to them as aforesaid, delivered to the use of our Soveraigne Lord the King&bholngs; Majestie, and his Heires and Successors, and the said s&bhooov;me in that writing or Estreat to be comprised to pay unto the high Colle&bholigct;or or Colle&bholigct;ors of that place for the colleccion of the same, in manner and forme underwritten, thereunto to be named and deputed, and the same. Inhabitants and Officers, so gathering the same particular s&bhooov;mes for their colleccion thereof, shall retaine for every twentie shillings so by them received and paid, two pence, And that to be allowed at the payment of their colleccion by them to be made, to the high Colle&bholigct;or or Colle&bholigct;ors.

section.head: XVIII. Commissioners may appoint Colle&bholigct;ors
section.para: to be High Colle&bholigct;ors.; Commissioners to deliver Estreats under their Seals and Sign Manual to Colle&bholigct;ors.; Colle&bholigct;ors to answer the Sums comprized in Estreat.

And further be it ena&bholigct;ed by the said Authoritie, that the said C&bhooov;missioners, or the more part of them, as shall take uppon (15) the execucion and busines of the said C&bhooov;mission, shall for every of the said payments of the said Subsidies name such sufficient and able &bhopubr;sons, which then shall have and possesse land&bholngs; and other Hereditament&bholngs; in their owne right of the cleare yearelie value of fortie pound&bholngs;, or goodes to the value of foure hundred pound&bholngs;, at the least, as he shalbe taxed in the Subsidie Booke, if any such be in the said lymitts, and for want of such so assessed, then those to be appointed Colle&bholigct;ors that then shalbe sufficient, and rated and taxed in the Subsidie Bookes in land&bholngs; and good&bholngs; neerest to the values aforesaid, as by their discrecions shalbe thought good in Shires, Ridings, Lathes, Wapentakes, Rapes, Cities, Townes, corporate, and other whatsoever places, as well within places priviledged, as without, not being foreprised within this A&bholigct;, to be high Colle&bholigct;ors, and to have the colleccion and receipt of the said s&bhooov;mes set and leviable within the &bhopubr;cin&bholigct; lymitts and bounds, where they shalbe so lymitted and appointed to be high Colle&bholigct;ors, And to every of the said Colle&bholigct;ors so severally named, the said C&bhooov;missioners or two of them at the least, with all speed and without delay, after the said whole s&bhooov;me of any payment of the said Subsidies be set by all the lymitts of the same their C&bhooov;mission, or in such lymitts as the high Colle&bholigct;ors shalbe so severallie assigned, shall under their Seales and Signe manuall, deliver one estreate indented in Parchment comprising in it the names of all such &bhopubr;sons as were assigned to levie the said particuler s&bhooov;mes, and the s&bhooov;mes of every Hundred, Wapentake, Towne, or other place aforesaid, with the names and surnames of the &bhopubr;sons so chargeable according to the Estreat so thereof first made, and delivered as is aforesaid. And the Colle&bholigct;ors to be assigned, shalbe charged to aunswere the whole s&bhooov;me comprised in the said Estreat lymitted to his colleccion, as is aforesaid.

section.head: XIX. Commissioners to take Recognizances of Colle&bholigct;ors.
section.para: Condition of Recognizance for first Subsidy.; Condition of Recognizance for Second Subsidy.; Commissioners to certify Recognizances,&c. into the Exchequer.; Penalty £10.; Colle&bholigct;or not making Recognizance.; Penalty £20l.; Exchequer to cancel Recognizances on Payment of Colle&bholigct;ion into Exchequer without Fee.; Colle&bholigct;or may appoint Days and Places for Payment of Colle&bholigct;ion.; Assessor,&c. not paying Colle&bholigct;ion to High Colle&bholigct;ors,; after Allowance of 2d. in the Pound for Colle&bholigct;ion; Distress.; Proceedings thereon.

Provided alwaies, and be it ena&bholigct;ed by the authoritie aforesaid that the said C&bhooov;missioners having authoritie by this A&bholigct; to name and nominate the same high Colle&bholigct;ors of every of the said Subsidies, shall ymediatelie uppon their nominacion and eleccion, take by authoritie of this &bhopcrl;sent Parliament, sufficient Recognizances or Obligacions, without any Fee or reward to be paid therefore, of every &bhopubr;son so by them to be named to be high Colle&bholigct;ors, to be bound to the King&bholngs; Majestie in the double s&bhooov;me of the s&bhooov;me of his colleccion, and to be indorsed and made uppon such condicion, that is to saie, for the colleccion of the payment of the said first Subsidie: That if the said Colle&bholigct;or his Heires or Executors doe trulie content and pay to the use of the King&bholngs; Majestie, his Heires or Successors in the receipt of the said Exchequer, at or before the last day of O&bholigct;ober, next ensuing, so much of the said s&bhooov;me of money allotted and appointed to his colleccion, as hee shall colle&bholigct;s and gather, and content and pay the residue of his colleccion and charge within one moneth next after such tyme, as hee hath colle&bholigct;ed and gathered the same residue, that then the saide Recognizances or Obligacions to be void, or els to stand in full strength and vertue, And for the colleccion of the said second Subsidie, uppon condicion, That if the said Colle&bholigct;or his heires or executors doe trulie content and pay to the use of the King&bholngs; Majestie his Heires or Successors in his receipt of Exchequer, at or before the said last day of Aprill which shalbe in the yeare of our Lord God, one thousand six hundred twentie and sixe, so much of the said s&bhooov;me of mony allotted and appointed to his colleccion, as he shall colle&bholigct; and gather, and content and pay the residue of his colleccion& charge within one moneth next after such tyme, as he hath colle&bholigct;ed and gathered the same residue, that then the said Recognizances or Obligacions to be void, or els to stand in full force and vertue: Which said severall Recognizances or Obligacions so taken, the said C&bhooov;missioners shall severallie certifie and deliver into the King&bholngs; Majesties Exchequer with the severall Certificates of the said Taxacions and Rates of the payment of the said Subsidies, at and by the tyme to them &bhopcrl;scribed and appointed by this A&bholigct;, for the certificate of the said severall Taxacions of the said Subsidies, uppon paine of forfeiture of ten pound&bholngs; to the King&bholngs; Majestie for every such Recognizance or Obligacion not so certified, And that every such Colle&bholigct;or so ele&bholigct;ed named and chosen uppon request to him made, shall knowledge and make the said Recognizance or Obligacion, uppon paine and forfeiture of twentie pound&bholngs; to the King&bholngs; Majestie for the refusall thereof; And that the Treasurer and Barons of the Exchequer for the tyme being uppon payment of the said severall colleccions of the Subsidies at the daies and tymes herein lymitted for the payment thereof shall cancell and deliver the Recognizances or Obligacions for the payment thereof to the Colle&bholigct;or or Colle&bholigct;ors without any other warrant, and without any fee or reward to be paid for the same to any &bhopubr;son. And every Colle&bholigct;or so deputed, having the said Estreat in parchment as is aforesaid, shall have authoritie by this A&bholigct; to appoint daies and places within the circuit of his colleccion, for the payment of the said Subsidies to him to be made and thereof to give warning by &bhopcrl;clamacion or otherwise, to all the Constables or other &bhopubr;sons or inhabitants, having the charge of the particular colleccion within the Hundreds, Parishes, Townes, or other places by him or them lymited, to make payment for the said particuler colleccion of every s&bhouov;me as to them shall appertayne. And if at the same day and place so lymitted and &bhopcrl;fixed by the said high Colle&bholigct;or, the said Constable Officers, or other &bhopubr;sons or inhabitants as is aforesaid, for the said particuler colleccion assigned and appointed within such Hundred Citie Towne or other place do not pay unto the said high Colle&bholigct;ors, the some within their severall Hundreds, Townes, Parishes, and other places due and comprised in the said Estreat thereof, to them delivered by the said C&bhooov;missioners or s&bhooov;me of them as is aforesaid, or so much thereof as they have by any meanes received two pence for every pound for the said particuler colleccion as is aforesaid, alwaies thereof to be allowed, excepted, and abated, that then it shalbe lawfull to the said high colle&bholigct;ors and every of them and to their assignes, to distraine every of the said Constables Officers and other inhabitants for their said severall and particuler colleccion of the said s&bhooov;mes comprised in the said Estreat and writing thereof to them and every of them as is before expressed, delivered or for so much of the same s&bhooov;me, as so then shall happen to be gathered and levied, and behinde and unpaid, by the good&bholngs; and chattell&bholngs; of every of them so being behinde, and the distresse so taken, to be kept and appraised and sold as is aforesaid, and thereof to take and levie the s&bhooov;mes so then being behinde and unpaid, and the overplus c&bhooov;ming of the sale of the said distresse (if any be) to be restored and delivered unto the owner in for me above remembred.

section.head: XX. Persons having been Colle&bholigct;ors of First Subsidy not to be appointed Colle&bholigct;ors of Second Subsidy, unless they shew Quietus est. Penalty £100.
section.para: Provided alwaies, and be it ena&bholigct;ed by the authoritie aforesaid, That no &bhopubr;son or &bhopubr;sons shalbe nominated or appointed to be a high Colle&bholigct;or or Colle&bholigct;ors for the second Subsidie, graunted by this A&bholigct;e, which before that tyme hath bene a Colle&bholigct;or or Colle&bholigct;ors for the first Subsidie, unlesse such &bhopubr;son or &bhopubr;sons so to be nominated and appointed high Colle&bholigct;or or Colle&bholigct;ors for the said second Subsidie, doe first shew forth before him or them by whome he shalbe nominated and appointed, his Quietus est for his discharge of his colleccion before appointed to his charge, uppon paine of one hundred pound&bholngs; to be paid and forfeited by him or them that so shall nominate and appoint any such Colle&bholigct;or contrary to this &bhopcrl;sent A&bholigct;.

section.head: XXI. Persons living in Cities,&c. not to be appointed Colle&bholigct;ors or Assessors out of them.
section.para: Provided alwaies that no &bhopubr;son inhabiting in any City. Borough or Towne corporate, shalbe compelled to be any Assessor or Colle&bholigct;or, of or for any part of the said Subsidies, in any place or places out of the said City, Borough or Towne corporate, where he dwelleth.

section.head: XXII. Assessors, Attornies, Fa&bholigct;ors,&c. after being charged with Receipt of Assessment, dying or removing or concealing their Good&bholngs;,
section.para: or when Monies comprised in Estreat cannot be levied by Distress; or where Distress cannot be sold; Process out of the Exchequer, and the Commissioners may dire&bholigct; Precepts to Officer to levy such Money.; Who may distrain.; Distress appraised and sold.; If Distress taken out of Limit assigned, Allowance.

And it is also by the said authoritie ena&bholigct;ed, That if any Inhabitants or Officers, or whatsoever &bhopubr;son or &bhopubr;sons charged to and for the colleccion and receipt of any part or porcion of the said Subsidies by any manner of meanes according to this A&bholigct;, or any &bhopubr;son or &bhopubr;sons for themselves, or as Keep, Guardian, Deputie, Fa&bholigct;or or Attorny, of or for anie other &bhopubr;son or &bhopubr;sons for any good&bholngs; or chattell&bholngs; of the owner thereof, at the tyme of the said assessing to be paid being out of this Realme, or in any other part&bholngs; not knowen, or of and for the good&bholngs; and chattell of any other &bhopubr;son or &bhopubr;sons of any corporacion, Fraternitie, Misterie or other whatsoever C&bhooov;monaltie, being corporate or not corporate, and all &bhopubr;sons having in their rule, governance and custodie any good&bholngs; or Chattell&bholngs; at the tyme of the said assessing, or any of them to be made, or which for anie cause, for and by colleccion, or for himselfe, or for any other, or by reason that he hath the rule, governance, or custodie of any good&bholngs; or chattell&bholngs; of any other &bhopubr;son or &bhopubr;sons, Corporacion, C&bhooov;monaltie, Fraternitie, Guild or Misterie, or any such other like, or as Fa&bholigct;or, Deputie or attorney of or for any &bhopubr;son, shalbe taxed valued rated and set, to any s&bhooov;me and s&bhooov;mes by reason of this A&bholigct;e, and after the taxacion and assessing uppon any such &bhopubr;son or &bhopubr;sons, as shalbe charged with the receipt of the same, happen to die or depart from the place where he was so taxed and set, or his good&bholngs; or chattell&bholngs; to be so eloined, or in such privie or covert manner kept, as the said &bhopubr;son or &bhopubr;sons charged with the same by Estreats or other writings from the said C&bhooov;missioners, or as many of them as shalbe thereunto appointed by the said C&bhooov;mission as is aforesaid, can, ne may levie the same s&bhooov;me and s&bhooov;mes comprised within the same Estreats, by distresse within the Lymitts of their colleccion, as is aforesaid, or cannott sell such distresse or distresses as be taken for any of the said payments before the tyme lymited to the high Colle&bholigct;or for his payment to be made in the King&bholngs; Majesties Receipt, then uppon relacion thereof, with due examinacion by the oath or examinacion of such &bhopubr;son. or &bhopubr;sons as shalbe charged with and for the receipt and colleccion of the same before the said C&bhooov;missioners, or as many of them, as by the said C&bhooov;mission shalbe thereunto appointed, where such &bhopubr;son or &bhopubr;sons, or other, as is aforesaid, their Good&bholngs; and Chattell&bholngs; were set and taxed, and uppon plaine Certificate thereof made into the King&bholngs; Majesties Exchequer by the same C&bhooov;missioners, as well of the dwelling place names and s&bhooov;mes of the said &bhopubr;sons of whome the same s&bhooov;mes cannott be levied and had as is aforesaid: Then as well the Constable and other Inhabitants appointed for the same particuler colleccion against the high Colle&bholigct;ors, as the high Colle&bholigct;or uppon his account and Oath in the said Exchequer, to be discharged thereof, and &bhopcrl;cesse to be made for the King&bholngs; Majestie out of the same Exchequer by the discrecion of the Barons of the same Exchequer against such &bhopubr;son his Heires or Executors so being behinde with his payment. And over that the same C&bhooov;missioners, to whome any such declaracion of the &bhopcrl;misses shalbe made in forme aforesaid from tyme to tyme, shall have full power and authoritie to dire&bholigct; their &bhopcrl;cept or &bhopcrl;cepts to the said &bhopubr;son or &bhopubr;sons charged with any s&bhooov;me, of for and uppon any such &bhopubr;son and &bhopubr;sons or other as is aforesaid, or to any Sheriffe, Steward, Bailiffe or other whatsoever Officer Minister, &bhopubr;son or &bhopubr;sons of such place or places, where any such &bhopubr;son or &bhopubr;sons so owing any such s&bhooov;me or s&bhooov;mes shall have Land&bholngs; and Tenement&bholngs; and other Hereditament&bholngs; or reall possessions, good&bholngs; and chattell&bholngs;, whereby any such &bhopubr;son or &bhopubr;sons so indebted, his Heires Executors or Assignes, or other having the Custodie governance or disposicion of any good&bholngs; or chattell&bholngs;, land&bholngs; tenement&bholngs; or other Hereditament&bholngs; which ought or may by this A&bholigct; be lawfully distreyned or taken for the same hath and shall have good&bholngs; chattell&bholngs; landes tenement&bholngs; or other possessions, whereof such s&bhooov;me and s&bhooov;mes, which by any such &bhopubr;son or &bhopubr;sons may or ought to be levied, be it within the lymitts of such C&bhooov;mission, where such &bhopubr;son or &bhopubr;sons was or were taxed or without in any place within this Realme of England, Wales, or other the King&bholngs; Majesties Dominions Marches or Territories, by which &bhopcrl;cept, aswell such &bhopubr;son or &bhopubr;sons shalbe charged to levie such monie, as the Officer of the place or places where such distresse may be taken, shall have full power and authoritie to distreyne every such &bhopubr;son indebted, charged or chargeable by this A&bholigct;, or his Executors or Administrators of his Goodes and Chattell&bholngs;, his Guardians, Fa&bholigct;ors, Deputies, Leassees, Farmors, and Assignes, and all other &bhopubr;sons, by whose hand&bholngs;, or out of whose land&bholngs; any such &bhopubr;son should have Fee, Rent, A$$$uitie, or other proffitt, or which at the tyme of the said assessing shall have good&bholngs; or chattell&bholngs;, or any other thing moveable of any such &bhopubr;son or &bhopubr;sons being indebted or owing such s&bhouov;me, and the distresses so taken, cause to be kept appraised and sold in like manner and forme, as is aforesaid, for the distresse to be taken uppon such &bhopubr;sons to be taxed to the said Subsidies, and being sufficient to distreyne within the lymitts of the Colle&bholigct;ors, Inhabitants or other officers charged with or for the said s&bhooov;mes so uppon them to be taxed. And if any such distresse for non payment happen to be taken out of the lymitt

Persons charged discharged by Distress.; Persons distrained having no Lands,&c.; Proceedings.; Imprisonment until Sums due, and also Fee for Arrest paid.; Officer not executing Process.; Penalty 2cs.; Gaoler suffering Escape.; Penalty 40s. and Double Value of Rate and Fees.; Like Process for Subsidies due by any Person charged for another unpaid.; In Default of Payment Imprisonment.; Certificate by Commissioners.; Colle&bholigct;ors,&c.; disobeying Commissioners.; Persons suspe&bholigct;ed to be not indifferently taxed refusing to appear or be examined,; Penalty 40s. or under, at Discretion of Commissioners.; Commissioners may punish by Imprisonment.

of the said &bhopubr;sons charged and assigned to levie the said &bhopubr;sons so charged for the levying of any such s&bhooov;mes by distresse, shall &bhopcrl;ceive and take of the same distresse, for the labour of every &bhopubr;son going for the execucion thereof, for every mile that every &bhopubr;son so laboureth for the same, two pence, And every Farmor, Guardian, Tenant, Fa&bholigct;or, or other whatsoever &bhopubr;son being distreyned, or other &bhopubr;son charged for [the16] payment of any such s&bhooov;me or s&bhooov;mes or any other s&bhooov;me by reason of this A&bholigct;, shalbe of such s&bhooov;me or s&bhooov;mes of him or them so levied and taken, discharged and acquited at his next day of payment for the same, or at the delivery of such Good&bholngs; and Chattell&bholngs; as he that is so distreyned, had in his custodie or governance against him or them that shalbe so taxed& set. Any Graunt or Writing obligatorie, or other whatsoever, matter to the contrary made heretofore notwithstanding. And if any such &bhopubr;son that should so be distreyned have no Land&bholngs; or Tenement&bholngs; sufficient, whereby he and his Tenants and Farmors may be distreyned, or have aliened eloyned, or hid his Good&bholngs; and Chattell&bholngs; whereby he should or might be distreyned, in such manner that such good&bholngs; or chattell&bholngs; should not be knowen or found, so that the s&bhooov;me of or by him to be paid in the said forme, shall not, ne can be convenientlie levied, then uppon relacion thereof to the C&bhooov;missioners, or to as many of them as by the said C&bhooov;mission shalbe thereunto appointed where such &bhopubr;son or &bhopubr;sons was taxed and sett by the oathes of him or them that shalbe charged with the levying and payment of that s&bhooov;me or s&bhooov;mes, the same C&bhooov;missioners shall make a &bhopcrl;cept in such manner as is aforesaid, for to attach take and arrest the body of such &bhopubr;son or &bhopubr;sons, that ought to pay the said s&bhooov;mes, and by this A&bholigct; shalbe charged with and for the said s&bhooov;me and s&bhooov;mes, and them so taken safelie to keepe in prison within the Shire or other place where any such &bhopubr;son or &bhopubr;sons shalbe taken and attached, there to remaine without baile or Mainsprise untill he hath paid the said s&bhooov;me or s&bhooov;mes, that such &bhopubr;son for himselfe or for any other by this A&bholigct; shalbe chargeable, or ought to be charged withall, and also for the Fees of every such Arrest, to him or them that shall execute such &bhopcrl;cept, twentie pence; And that every Officer, unto whome such &bhopcrl;cept shalbe dire&bholigct;ed doe his true diligence and execute the same uppon every &bhopubr;son so being indebted, upon paine to forfeite to the King&bholngs; Majestie for every default in that behalfe, twentie shillings. And that no keep of any Gaole, from his Gaole suffer any such &bhopubr;son to goe at large, by letting to Baile, or otherwise to depart out of his prison before he have paid his said debt, and the said twentie pence for his Arrest, upon paine to forfeit to the King&bholngs; Majestie fortie shillings: And the same Gaoler to pay to the King&bholngs; Majestie the double value as well of the rate, which the said &bhopubr;son so imprisoned was taxed at, as of the said twentie pence for the fees. And like &bhopcrl;cesse and remedie in like forme shalbe graunted by the said C&bhooov;missioners or as many of them as by the said C&bhooov;mission shalbe thereunto appointed at like Informacion of every &bhopubr;son or &bhopubr;sons being charged with any s&bhooov;me of mony for any other &bhopubr;son or &bhopubr;sons by reason of the said Subsidies, and not thereof paid, but willfully withdrawen, nor the same leviable within the lymitts where such &bhopubr;sons were thereunto taxed. And if the s&bhooov;me or s&bhooov;mes being behind unpaid by any &bhopubr;son or &bhopubr;sons as is aforesaid, be levied and gathered by force of the said &bhopcrl;cesse to be made by the said C&bhooov;missioners, or if in default or for lacke of payment thereof, the &bhopubr;son or &bhopubr;sons so owing the said s&bhooov;me and s&bhooov;mes of mony, by &bhopcrl;cesse of the same C&bhooov;missioners to be made, as is aforesaid, be c&bhooov;mitted to prison in forme abovesaid, that then the said C&bhooov;missioners, which shall award such &bhopcrl;ces shall make Certificate thereof in the said Exchequer of that shalbe done in the &bhopcrl;misses in the Terme next following after such s&bhooov;me or s&bhooov;mes of mony, so being behinde shalbe levied and gathered, or such &bhopubr;son or &bhopubr;sons for non payment of the same, c&bhooov;mitted to prison. And if it happen any of the said Colle&bholigct;ors to be assigned, or any Maiors, Sheriffs, Stewards, Constables, the Headborough, Bursholder, Bayliffe or any other Officer or Minister, or other whatsoever &bhopubr;son or &bhopubr;sons to disobey the said C&bhooov;missioners, or any of them in the reasonable request to them made by the said Commissioners for the execucion of the said C&bhooov;mission, or if any of the Officers, or other &bhopubr;sons dóe refuse that to them shall appertaine and belong to doe by reason of anie &bhopcrl;cept to him or them to be dire&bholigct;ed, or any reasonable c&bhooov;maundement instance or request touching the &bhopcrl;misses or other default in any appearance or colleccion to make, or if any &bhopubr;son being suspe&bholigct;ed not to be indifferentlie taxed, as is aforesaid, doe refuse to be examined according to the tenor of this A&bholigct; before the said C&bhooov;missioners, or as many of them as shalbe thereunto assigned, as is aforesaid, or will not appeare before the said C&bhooov;missioners upon warning to him made, or else make resistance or rescues upon any distresse, upon him to be taken for anie parcell of the said Subsidies, or committ any misbehavior in any manner of wise contrarie to this A&bholigct; or c&bhooov;mitt any willfull omission, or other whatsoever willfull doing or misdoing contrary to the tenor of this A&bholigct; or Graunte; The same C&bhooov;missioners, and every nomber of them above remembred or two of them at the least uppon probable knowledge of any such misdemeanors had by Informacion or Examinacion, shall and may sett upon every such offendor for every such offence in the name of a Fyne by the same offendor to be forfeited, fortie shillings or under, by discrecion of the same C&bhooov;missioners. And further the said C&bhooov;missioners and every nomber of them or two of them at the least, shall have authoritie by this &bhopcrl;sent A&bholigct;, to punish every such offender by imprisonment, there to remaine and to be delivered by their discrecion,16 as shall seeme to them convenient, the said Fynes (if any such be) to be certified by the said C&bhooov;missioners that so assessed the same into the King&bholngs; Majesties Exchequer there to be levied and paid by the Colle&bholigct;ors of that part for the said Subsidies retorned into the said Exchequer to be therewith charged with the payment of the said Subsidies in such manner as if the said Fines had bene sett and taxed uppon the said offenders for the said Subsidies.

section.head: XXIII. Allowance to High Colle&bholigct;ors and their Accountants.
