section.para: Allowance to be paid by Colle&bholigct;ors to Commissioners for Expences and Labours of their Clerks.; Remedy for the same for Commissioners against Colle&bholigct;ors.

And be it also ena&bholigct;ed by the said authoritie of this &bhopcrl;sent Parliament That every of the said high Colle&bholigct;ors, which shall account for any part of the said Subsidies in the said Exchequer uppon their severall accounts to be yeilded, shalbe allowed at every of the said payments of the said Subsidies for every pound lymited to his colleccion, whereof any such Colle&bholigct;or shalbe charged and yeild account, sixe pence as parcell of their charge, that is to saie, of every pound thereof for such &bhopubr;sons as then have had the particuler colleccion of the Townes and other places as is aforesaid specified in his colleccion, two pence and other two pence of every pound thereof, every of the said cheife Colle&bholigct;ors, or their Accomptants to retaine to their owne use, for their labour and charge in and about the &bhopcrl;misses, and two pence of everie pound residue, to be delivered allowed and paid by the said Colle&bholigct;or so being thereof. allowed, to such of the C&bhooov;missioners, as shall take uppon them the busines and labour for and about the &bhopcrl;misses, that is to saie, Every Colle&bholigct;or to pay that C&bhooov;missioner or C&bhooov;missioners, which had the ordering of the writings of and for every of the said Subsidies, where the said Colle&bholigct;or or Colle&bholigct;ors had their colleccion, for the expences for the said C&bhooov;missioners, so taking uppon them the said businesse, and labour of their Clarkes writing the said &bhopcrl;cepts and Extacts of the said Colleccions, the said last two pence of every pound to be devided amongest the said C&bhooov;missioners, having regard to their labour and busines taken by them and their said Clarkes in and about the &bhopcrl;misses, for which part, so to the said C&bhooov;missioners appertayning, the said C&bhooov;missioners six, five, foure, three, or two, or as many of them as shalbe thereunto appointed by the Kinges Majesties C&bhooov;mission, and every of them joyntlie and severallie for his and their said part, may have his remedie against the Colle&bholigct;or or Colle&bholigct;ors, which thereof byn or might have bin allowed by accion of debt, in which the Defendant shall not wage his Lawe, neither Proteccion, neither Injunccion or Essoine shalbe allowed.

section.head: XXIV. Commissioners,&c. not compellable to make Presentments other than to Exchequer.
section.para: And that no &bhopubr;son, now being of the nomber of this &bhopcrl;sent Parliament, nor any C&bhooov;missioner shalbe named or assigned to be any Colle&bholigct;or or Subcolle&bholigct;or or Presenter of the said Subsidies, or any part thereof, nor any C&bhooov;missioners shalbe compelled to make any &bhopcrl;sentment or Certificate, other then [into17] the King&bholngs; Majesties said Exchequer, of for or concerning the said Subsidies, or any part or parcell thereof. And likewise that no other &bhopubr;son that shalbe named and assigned to be C&bhooov;missioners in any place to and for the execucion of this A&bholigct; of Subsidies, be or shalbe assigned or named head Colle&bholigct;or of any of the Payments of the said Subsidies [neither18] of any part thereof.

section.head: XXV. Head Colle&bholigct;ors for First Subsidy not compellable to be Colle&bholigct;ors of Second Subsidy.
section.para: Taking Fees of Accountants.; Penalty.; Imprisonment.; Commissioners at Meetings to shew Certificates and Presentments to the other Commissioners.; Indenture of Colle&bholigct;ors Names and of Sums written to Colle&bholigct;ors, Fines.&c. to be certified by Commissioners into the Exchequer.; Colle&bholigct;ors answerable for their own Colle&bholigct;ion only.

And that every such &bhopubr;son or &bhopubr;son which shalbe named and appointed as is aforesaid to be head Colle&bholigct;ors of and for the payment of the said first Subsidie, or of any part thereof, shall not be compelled to be Colle&bholigct;or for the payment of the said second Subsidie nor any part thereof. . And the said Colle&bholigct;ors which shalbe assigned for the colleccion of the said two Subsidies, or of any part thereof and every of them, be and shalbe acquited and discharged of all manner Fees and Rewards and of every other charge in the King&bholngs; Majesties Exchequer, or elswhere, of them, or any of them by reason of that colleccion payment or accompt, or any thing con&bhoccrl;ning the same to be asked, And that if any &bhopubr;son receive or take any Fees, Rewards or pleasures of any such Accomptants, or use any unnecessary delay in their accompt, that then he shall forfeit to the King&bholngs; Majestie for every penny or value of every pennyworth so taken, five shillings, and five pound&bholngs; to the partie greived for every such delay, and suffer imprisonment at the Kinges Majesties pleasure. And after every taxing and assessing of the said severall Subsidies (as is aforesaid) had or made, and the said extacts thereof in Parchment, unto the Colle&bholigct;or in manner and forme before rehearsed, delivered, The said C&bhooov;missioners, which shall take uppon them the execucion of this A&bholigct;e within the limitts of their C&bhooov;mission by their agreements, shall have meetings together, At which meeting every of the said C&bhooov;missioners, which then shall have taken uppon them the execucion of any part of the said C&bhooov;mission, shall by himselfe or his sufficient Deputie trulie certifie and bring forth unto the said C&bhooov;missioners named in the said C&bhooov;mission, the Certificate and Presentment made before him and such other C&bhooov;missioners as were lymitted with him in one limitt, so as the same certificate may be accompted and cast with the other Certificates of the other limitts within the same C&bhooov;mission, and then the said C&bhooov;missioners and every nomber of them, unto two at the least, as is aforesaid, if any be in life, or their Executors or Administrators of their good&bholngs;, if they then be dead, shall joyntlie and severallie as they were divided within their lymitts under their seales, by their discrecion make one or severall writings indented, contayning in itt aswell the names of the said Colle&bholigct;ors by the C&bhooov;missioners for such colleccions and accounts in the Exchequer and payments in the said receipt, deputed and assigned, as the grosse and severall s&bhooov;mes written unto every such Colle&bholigct;ors to receive the said Subsidies, and also all Fynes, Amerciaments, and other Forfeitures, if any such by reason of this A&bholigct;e, happen to be within the limitt and &bhopcrl;cin&bholigct; of their C&bhooov;mission, to be certified into the King&bholngs; Majesties said Exchequer by the said C&bhooov;missioners. In which writing or writings indented so to be certified, shalbe plainelie declared and expressed the whole and entire s&bhooov;me or s&bhooov;mes of the said Subsidies severally lymited to the colle&bholigct;ion of the said Colle&bholigct;ors, severally deputed and assigned to the said s&bhooov;mes, Soe as none of the said Colle&bholigct;ors, so certified in the said Exchequer, shalbe compelled there to account, or to be charged, but onelie to and for the s&bhooov;mes lymitted to his colleccion, and not to or for any s&bhooov;me lymited to the colleccion of his fellowes: But every of them shalbe severallie charged for their, part lymited to their Colleccion.

section.head: XXVI. Commissioners, if they cannot agree,&c. may make several Indentures.
section.para: Colle&bholigct;ors not chargeable for other Colle&bholigct;ors.; Commissioners or Colle&bholigct;ors or Persons taxed, dying before discharged, Heirs and Executors chargeable as such Persons would have been if alive.

And if the said C&bhooov;missioners joyned in one C&bhooov;mission amongest themselves in that matter cannott agree, or if any of them be not ready, or refuse, to make certificate with other of the same C&bhooov;missioners, that then the said C&bhooov;missioners may make severall Indentures [in forme19] aforesaid, of their, sev[ers]all lymitts or separacions of Colle&bholigct;ors within the limitts of their C&bhooov;mission, uppon and in the Hundreds, Wards, Wapentakes, Rapes, or such other like divisions, within the said severall lymitts of their C&bhooov;mission, as the places there shall require to be severed and divided, and as to the same C&bhooov;missioners shall seeme good to make divisions or other lymitts or Colleccions, for the severall charges of the same Colle&bholigct;ors, so that alway one Colle&bholigct;or shalbe charged, and account for his part to him to be lymitted onely by himselfe, and not for any some lymitted to the part of any of his fellowes: And the charges of every of the colle&bholigct;ors to be set and certified severally uppon them. And every such Colle&bholigct;or uppon his account and payment of the s&bhooov;me of monie lymited within [his20] colleccion to be severallie by himselfe acquited and discharged in the said Exchequer without paying any manner Fees or Rewards to any &bhopubr;son or &bhopubr;sons for the same, upon paine and Penaltie last abovesaid, and not to be charged for any porcion of any other Colle&bholigct;or. And if any C&bhooov;missioner after he hath taken certificate of them, that, as is aforesaid, shalbe before any C&bhooov;missioners exaied and the s&bhooov;mes rated and set, and the bookes and writings thereof being in his handv, or if any Colle&bholigct;or or other &bhopubr;son charged with anie receipt of anie part of the said Subsidies, or any other &bhopubr;son taxed or otherwise by this A&bholigct; charged with or for any parcell of the said Subsidies, or with any other s&bhooov;me Fine An&bhotcrl;ciament Penaltie, or other Forfeiture, happen to die before the C&bhooov;missioners Colle&bholigct;or or other whatsoever &bhopubr;son or &bhopubr;sons have executed, accomplished satisfied, or sufficientlie discharged that, to which every such &bhopubr;son shall appertaine or belong to doe according to this A&bholigct;, Then the Executors and Heires of every such &bhopubr;son, and all other seized of any Land&bholngs; and Tenement&bholngs; that any such &bhopubr;son being charged by this A&bholigct; and deceasing before he be discharged thereof, or any other to his use onelie, had of an Estate of Inheritance at the tyme that any such &bhopubr;son was named C&bhooov;missioner, Colle&bholigct;or, or otherwise charged with or for any manner of thing to be done satisfied or paid by reason of this A&bholigct;. And all those that have in their possession or hand&bholngs; any Good&bholngs;, Chattell&bholngs;, Leases, or other thing&bholngs; that were to any such &bhopubr;son or &bhopubr;sons at the time of his death, or any Land&bholngs; or Tenement&bholngs; that were the same &bhopubr;sons at the time that he was, as is aforesaid, charged by this A&bholigct; shalbe by the same compelled and charged to doe, and accomplish in every case, as the same &bhopubr;son so being charged should have done, or might have byn compelled to doe, if he had bene in plaine life, after such rate of the Land&bholngs; and Good&bholngs; of the said C&bhooov;missioner or Colle&bholigct;or, as the partie shall have in his Hand&bholngs;.

section.head: XXVII. Commissioners not thinking fit to join in one Certificate Proceedings.
section.para: Commissioners making Default of Certificate, Process out of Exchequer against them.

And if the said C&bhooov;missioners for causes reasonable them moving, shall thinke it not fitt to joyne in one Certificate, as is aforesaid, then the said &bhopubr;son or &bhopubr;sons, that shall first joyne together, or hee that shall first certifie the said writing indented as is aforesaid, shall certifie all the names of the C&bhooov;missioners of that C&bhooov;mission, whereuppon such writing shalbe there then to be certified, with division of the Hundreds, Wapentakes, Wards, Tything&bholngs;, and other places, to and among such C&bhooov;missioners of the same C&bhooov;mission, with the names of the said C&bhooov;missioners, where such Separacions and Divisions shalbe, with the grosse s&bhooov;mes of money, aswell of and for the said Subsidies taxed or set, of or within the said Hundreds, Wards, Wapentakes, or other places to him or them divided or assigned, that shall so certifie the said first Writings, as of the Fines, Amerciaments, Penalties and other Forfeitures, if any happen to be within the same Limitts, whereof the same writings shalbe certified: And after such writings indented, which, as is aforesaid, shalbe certified, and not contayne in it the whole and full s&bhooov;mes set and taxed within the Limits of the same C&bhooov;mission, the other C&bhooov;missioners of the same, before the day of payment of the said Subsidie, shall certifie into the said Exchequer, by their writing or writings indented to be made, as is aforesaid, the grosse and severall s&bhooov;mes, set and taxed within the places to them limited, for every of the said Subsidies, and other fines, an&bhotcrl;ciaments, penalties and forfeiture, with the names of the [Hundreds,21] Wards, Wapentakes, and other Places to them assigned, or else by their said writings indented, to certifie at the same place, before the same day of payment, such reasonable causes for their excuses, why they may not make such certificate of and for the said Subsidies Fines Amerciaments and other forfeitures growing or set by reason of the causes of their lets, or of their not certifying, as is aforesaid, or else in default thereof, &bhopcrl;cesse to be made out of the King&bholngs; Majesties said Exchequer, against the said C&bhooov;missioners, and every of them not making certificate, as is aforesaid, by the discrecion of the Tresurer and Barons of the said Exchequer.

section.head: XXVIII. Proviso for Stamford Baron.
section.para: Provided alwaies, and be it ena&bholigct;ed by the authoritie aforesaid, That the inhabitants of the Parishe of Saint Martine called Stamford Baron in the Suburbs of the Borough and Towne of Stamford, in the South part [of22] the waters there, called Welland&bholngs;, which hereafter shalbe contributory to the payment of these &bhopcrl;sent Subsidies, graunted to the King&bholngs; Majestie, his Heires and Successors, shalbe assessed, rated, and taxed for the same, by such C&bhooov;missioners, which shalbe appointed for the taxing, rating, and sessing of the same Subsidies within the Countie of Lincolne, and shalbe for the same contributorie, and pay the said Subsidies, to the Colle&bholigct;or or Colle&bholigct;ors, which shalbe assigned and appointed for the levying and gathering of the same, with the Aldermen and Burgesses of the same Borough and Towne of Stamford.

section.head: XXIX. Persons having Spiritual and Temporal Possessions, and also Personal Property, not to be doubly charged.
section.para: Provided alwaies, and be it further ena&bholigct;ed by the authoritie aforesaid, That all and every &bhopubr;son and &bhopubr;sons having Mannors Land&bholngs; Tenement&bholngs;,. and other Hereditament&bholngs; chargeable to the payment of the said Subsidies graunted to the King&bholngs; Majestie by this A&bholigct;e, and also having Spirituall possessions chargeable to his said Majestie by anie graunt made or to be made by the Clergie of this Realme in their Convocacion, and over this, having substance in good&bholngs; and chattell&bholngs; chargeable by this said A&bholigct;e, that then, if any of the said &bhopubr;son or &bhopubr;sons be hereafter charged, assessed and taxed for the said Mannors Land&bholngs; and Tenement&bholngs;, and Spirituall possessions, and also charged assessed and taxed for his and their good&bholngs; and chattell&bholngs;, that then he or they shalbe onelie charged by vertue of this A&bholigct; for his and their said Mannors Land&bholngs; Tenement&bholngs; Hereditament&bholngs; and Spirituall possessions, or onelie for his said good&bholngs; and chattell&bholngs;, the best thereof to be taken for the King&bholngs; Majestie, and not to be charged for both, or double charged for any of them; Any thing in this A&bholigct; conteyned to the contrary in any wise notwithstanding.

section.head: XXX. Exception for Scotland, Ireland, Jersey and Guernsey.
section.para: Provided alwaies, that this graunte of Subsidies, or any thing therein conteyned, in any wise extend not to charge the Inhabitants dwelling in Scotland, Ireland, Jersey, and Garnesey, or any of them, of, for or concerning any Mannors, Land&bholngs;, Tenement&bholngs;, or other possessions, good&bholngs;, chattell&bholngs;, or other moveable substance, which the said Inhabitants or dwellers, or any others to their use have within Scotland, Ireland, Jersey and Garnesey, or in any of them, or of, for, or concerning any Fees or Wages, which any of the said Inhabitants or dwellers have of the King&bholngs; Majestie for their attendance and doing service to our Soveraigne Lord the King&bholngs; Majestie in Scotland, Ireland, Jersey and Garnesey, or in any of them. Any thing in this &bhopcrl;sent A&bholigct; to the contrary in any wise notwithstanding.

section.head: XXXI. Exception for English Inhabitants of Berwick-upon-Tweed.
section.para: Provided also, That this &bhopcrl;sent A&bholigct; of Subsidies, ne any thing therein conteyned, extend to any of the English Inhabitants or resiants in the Towne of Berwicke, for or concerning any Mannors, Land&bholngs;, Tenement&bholngs;, or other possessions, goodes, chattell&bholngs;, or other moveable substance, which the same English Inhabitants or dwellers, or any other to their use, have within the said Towne of Berwick, or for or concerning any Fees or wages, which any of the English inhabitants or dwellers have of the King&bholngs; Majestie for their attendance or doing service to the King&bholngs; Majestie, for, or, within the said Towne, but that the English inhabitants and resiants, and every of them shalbe of, and from the said Subsidies, and every parcell thereof, onelie for their said Mannors, Land&bholngs;, Tenement&bholngs;, Fees, Wages, Good&bholngs;, and Chattell&bholngs;, lying and being in the said Towne of Berwicke, utterlie acquitted and discharged, Any thing in this &bhopcrl;sent A&bholigct; before rehearsed to the contrary notwithstanding.

section.head: XXXII. Proviso for Patents of Liberties,&c. to Cities,&c.
section.para: Provided also, that all l[ia]res Patents graunted by the King&bholngs; Majestie, or any of his most noble Progenitors, to any Cities, Boroughes, or Townes within this Realme, of any manner of Liberties Priviledges or exempcions from the burthen and charge of any such graunt&bholngs; of Subsidies, which be at this &bhopcrl;sent tyme in force and availeable, shall remaine good and effe&bholigct;uall to the said Cities, Boroughes, and Townes hereafter according to the purports thereof, although the Inhabitants of the same, and also the said Corporacions, shall uppon the great and weightie consideracions of the Graunte aforesaid, be for this Graunt charged and contributorie in like manner forme and sort, as other Cities, Boroughes, and Townes, which be not in any wise priviledged, but by this A&bholigct; charged.
Proviso for Orphans and Infants.

Provided alwaies, and be it ena&bholigct;ed by the authoritie aforesaid,' That no Orphan or Infant within the age of one and twentie yeares, borne within any of the King&bholngs; Majesties Dominions, shalbe charged to any payment of these Subsidies, for his or their Good&bholngs; and chattell&bholngs; to him or her left or bequeathed. Any thing in this A&bholigct; contayned to the contrary notwithstanding.

section.head: XXXIII. Proviso for Universities of Oxford and Cambridge and Winchester College and Eaton College and the poor Knights of Windsor and Free Schools and Readers,&c. in the Universities of Oxford and Cambridge and for Hospitals,&c.
section.para: Provided also that this A&bholigct;, nor any thing therein contayned, shall extend to the land&bholngs; or good&bholngs; of any Colledge, Hall or Hostell, within the Univ[er]sities of Oxford and Cambridge, or any of them, or to the Good&bholngs; or Land&bholngs; of the Colledge of Winton founded by Bishopp Wickham, or to the good&bholngs; or land&bholngs; of the Colledge of Eaton next Windsor, or to the Land&bholngs;, Tenement&bholngs;, or revenues onelie assigned and appointed for the sustentacion and living of the poore Knights founded in the Castle or Colledge of Windsor by our late Soveraigne Lord King Henry the eight, or to any the Good&bholngs; or Chattell&bholngs; of the same Knights or any of them, or to the Good&bholngs; or land&bholngs; of any c&bhooov;mon free Grammar Schoole within the Realme of England or Wales, or to the good&bholngs; of any Reader Schoolemaster or Scholler, or any Graduate or Resiant, or remayning for studie without fraude or covin within any the said Univ[er]sities and Colledges or townes of Oxford and Cambridge, or Suburbes of the same, or to any of them, or to any their servants attending dailie uppon any of them, nor to the good&bholngs; of any Officer Minister Almes men or servants belonging to any of the said Univ[er]sities, Colledges, Halls, or Hostells, and dwelling and resiant within the said Univ[er]sities, or either of them, or within either of the said Townes of Oxford and Cambridge& the Suburbes of the same without fraude or covin, or to the good&bholngs;, and land&bholngs; of any Hospitall, Maisondieu, or Spittle house &bhopcrl;pared and used for the sustentacion and releife of poore people, Any thing in this A&bholigct; contayned to the contrary in any wise notwithstanding.

section.head: XXXIV. Inhabitants of Cinque Ports for the most part of the Year before the Grant chargeable during Resiance only.
section.para: Provided also, and be it further ena&bholigct;ed, that the said Grant of Subsidies, or any thing therein contayned, doe not in any wise extend or be &bhopcrl;judiciall or hurtfull to any of the inhabitants or resiants having dwelt for the most part of the yeare next before the taxing and assessing of the said Subsidies as aforesaid, within the five ports corporate, or to anie their members incorporated, or united to the said five Ports, or to anie of the said five Ports, but that such the inhabitants or Resiants as aforesaid, in the said five Ports corporate, and their members, be and shalbe of and from the said Graunt and payment of every of the said Subsidies, and every part thereof, and onelie during their resiance as aforesaid, and no longer, clearelie acquited and discharged, Any matter or whatsoever thing in this &bhopcrl;sent A&bholigct; had or made to the contrary notwithstanding.

section.head: XXXV. Proviso for Inhabitants of Rumney Marsh.
section.para: Provided also that the said Grant of Subsidies doe not in any wise extend to be &bhopcrl;judiciall or hurtfull to the English Inhabitants or Resiants at this &bhopcrl;sent tyme within the Liberties of Rumney Marsh, of or for any part of the said s&bhooov;mes graunted in this &bhopcrl;sent Parliament, of the said English Inhabitants now there Resiants, or any of them, to be taxed, set, asked, levied, or paid, but that the said English Inhabitants, and now Resiants of Rumney Marsh aforesaid and every of them, be and shalbe of and from, the graunt and payment of the said Subsidies during their [Resiance23] there, and no longer acquited and discharged, Any matter, and whatsoever thing in this &bhopcrl;sent A&bholigct; made to the contrary notwithstanding.

section.head: XXXVI. Alien or Denizen assigning his Land&bholngs;v,&c. to his Child with Intent to defraud the Subsidy, such Child chargeable as an Alien.
section.para: Provided neverthelesse, and be it ena&bholigct;ed by the authoritie aforesaid, That if any Alien or Straunger borne, Denizen, or not Denizen, and dwelling and inhabiting within this Realme of England, shall assigne and convey over unto any his or their childe or children borne within the said Realme of England, any his or their Land&bholngs;, Tenement&bholngs;, Good&bholngs; or Chattell&bholngs;, to the intent thereby to defraud the King&bholngs; Majestie of his said Subsidies of or for the same, that then all and every such childe and children, so being seised of any such Land&bholngs; and Tenement&bholngs;, and possessed of any such good&bholngs; or chattell&bholngs; shalbe charged and chargeable to and with the payment of double the said Subsidies for the same Land&bholngs;, Tenement&bholngs;, Good&bholngs;, and Chattell&bholngs; at the said rates and values, as Aliens and Straungers, Denizens, and not Denizens are before limited and appointed to pay.
